document: Chapter 5: Data Visualization to the End User - Fundamentals of Data Science

questions.question: Data scientists must deliver their insights to end users through various communication methods.
A one-time presentation is suitable for research questions that are one-shot deals.
Customer segmentation cannot be fed back to a database as a new dimension.
Real-time dashboards are never useful for data science results.
Strategic decisions often require only one-time analysis and reporting.
Operational decisions require reports to be refreshed regularly.
In large organizations, data scientists typically handle the entire cycle from data gathering to reporting.
A report is any communication artifact prepared to convey specific information.
Reports cannot persuade others to act; they only provide information.
A business report is a written document containing information regarding business matters.
The purpose of a business report is to worsen managerial decisions.
Business reports can use data from inside and outside the organization.
Business reports should be unclear to allow for interpretation.
Brevity is not important in business reporting.
Formal reports can be 10-100 pages with a cover, summary, and text.
Data visualization is the use of visual representations to explore and communicate data.
Information visualization involves aggregation, summarization, and contextualization of data.
Data visualization and information visualization are completely unrelated.
Line charts are not useful for showing trends over time.
Bar charts are effective for comparing categorical data.
Pie charts should be used when you have more than 7 categories.
Scatter plots show relationships between two continuous variables.
Bubble charts add a third dimension using bubble size.
Histograms display the distribution of a continuous variable.
Gantt charts are used for project scheduling.
PERT stands for Program Evaluation Review Technique.
Geographic maps cannot be used in data visualization.
Bullet graphs are not useful for comparing performance against targets.
Heat maps use color intensity to represent data values.
Tree maps display hierarchical data as nested rectangles.
Highlight tables are not effective for comparing values across categories.
The choice of chart depends on what you want to communicate.
All charts are equally effective for all types of data.
Data visualization should not be used in business reports.
